meanings.definition: A person who haggles or bargains, especially over the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The hagglers at the market were trying to get a better deal on fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The group of hagglers negotiated with the seller to lower the price of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The hagglers at the flea market were like detectives searching for the best bargains.
meanings.sent4: In the world of hagglers, every price tag is just a starting point for a battle of wits.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hagglers arguing over prices was etched in his memory.

meanings.sent1: The hagglers gathered around the table to discuss their negotiation strategies.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the hagglers in the market trying to outdo each other in bargaining.
meanings.sent3: The hagglers in the auction house were like a flock of birds fighting over the best deals.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the sound of hagglers, each trying to win the battle of prices.
meanings.sent5: Among the hagglers, she stood out as the most skilled in getting discounts.
